title: What is magnetic compass needle? - Quora

response.answer_text: A tautology. I suppose technically you could have a compass which has a demagnetized needle. So you know a compass? You see that pointy thing in it? That’s the compass needle. If it is also a magnet, then it is a magnetic compass needle.
The needle of a magnetic compass is the indicator, often either balanced on a point to swing freely in air, or floating on water or a similar fluid, that moves to indicate magnetic north and south.
